sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Dragon curve.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Dragon curve generated by recursively following the instructions "take a straight line, divide it into two, and insert a right angle" 10 times?
message_2:
The Hausdorff dimension (D) of a self-similar fractal like the Dragon curve can be calculated using the formula:

D = log(N) / log(S)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces, and S is the scaling factor.

For the Dragon curve, after each iteration, the number of line segments doubles (N = 2), and the scaling factor is the square root of 2 (S = √2) because each new segment is half the length of the previous one and forms a right angle.

So, the Hausdorff dimension of the Dragon curve is:

D = log(2) / log(√2)

D ≈ 1.523

The Hausdorff dimension of the Dragon curve generated by recursively following the instructions 10 times is approximately 1.523.
